title.narrative: Water recource management in the Mekong Delta

description.narrative: The scope of this proposed work is a study resulting in potentially highly practical applications, including collection of existing data on (quantity, level and quality) surface water and groundwater as well as existing geological data concerning the two provinces; collection of some additional field data; testing of groundwater infiltration and monitoring of those tests; testing of (sustainable) efficient use of fresh groundwater sources (drip irrigation, soil moisture sensors); and making the results available to planners, local officials and water users. The scope does not include major surveys, setting up of permanent monitoring systems, or construction of major water recharge and extraction systems. The objectives are:1. To collect and assess data and measures for increasing freshwater resources by seasonal infiltration into freshwater lenses, confined aquifers and sustainable use of groundwater.2. To create provincial overviews of the potential for restoring phreatic fresh groundwater, deep well infiltration, and construction of fresh water reservoirs with limited evaporation losses.3. To study, design and run tests/ pilots of a limited number of technologies for groundwater recharge and efficient water use in case study areas.4. To screen the water quality status in case study areas, with particular reference to pesticides and heavy metals, as recharge with polluted surface water must be avoided.5. To assess the potential for upgrading existing livelihood systems or introducing new systems that are consistent with long terms water security and sustainable water use.6. To make recommendations for upscaling potential measures, plans and guidelines for sustainable water use and related potential for food security and livelihood systems in which surface and groundwater are integrated.
